item.title: Multiple large potholes at tbe beginning on linworth road. Looks as though attemps have been made to fix them but it is a complete mess. The whole stretch of road should be repaged, 10th February
item.description:
Multiple potholes at beginning of linworth road. Between 2-10 is the worst. Very high traffic area with buses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linworth Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes all down Winton close, 10th February
item.description:
Winton close especially in front of the green area as you come around the corner is full of pot holes some of which a larger than 18” and 3” deep. The whole road is like a patchwork quilt. These holes were filled less than 2 years ago and are back and even worse than before

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Winton Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains are blocking on a regular basis with excessive water running across the road from junction of Cirencester road and road up to Birdlip (12 bells pub junction) both from the overflowing ditches from farmland and surface water running off from the side of telephone exchange. This is causing regular flooding to the road and our driveway despite me regularly clearing drains during heavy downpours., 10th February
item.description:
Drains directly outside Woodleigh, Cirencester Road are regularly blocked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous pothole, 10th February
item.description:
Has had a bollard over it but that’s been knocked over so pothole more dangerous . No white circle
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 potholes in middle of road., 10th February
item.description:
3 potholes in middle of road outside house number 3 Vineries Close. 1 pothole outside house number 21. All have loose stones coming out into Road which could cause vehicle windscreens to shatter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Vineries Close, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road subsided on drop kerb, 10th February
item.description:
Outside number 31 Oakfield Road. Road has subsided on drop kerb. Driving car of the driveway always hits that dip in the road. It has been there ever since we moved in about 3 years ago!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43,45, Oakfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights constantly changing, 10th February
item.description:
The lights on this pedestrian crossing are constantly changing without any control. The result is traffic stopping for no reason at all every few seconds causing a jam at times that is causing the ambulances from the ambulance station to be delayed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Deep Pothole - Caernarvon Road, 10th February
item.description:
This is where your nearside wheels are, as you approach the mini roundabout in a north westerly direction. It's over 3" deep, in my opinion. Both my nearside wheels hit it hard and I'll be getting checks for damage to my wheels and tyres. I have reported it as an emergency to Gloucestershire Highways as, apart from the damage, if you were on a motorcycle or a bicycle and hit this, you'd likely be thrown off.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 139, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes around roundabout, 10th February
item.description:
Long/multiple holes in road, specifically in the lane turning right from Up Hatherley Way towards Shurdington. They are a danger to cyclists given their groove like nature.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long, thin potholes heading southbound after roundabout, 10th February
item.description:
Long / multiple potholes heading southbound after mini-roundabout on Alma Rd. It's been like this for a long time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous hole on the pavement, 10th February
item.description:
It’s been there for well over 2 years. Several teams of different workers have used tarmac up to it and around it but no one has ever filled it. It is now a huge dangerous hole in the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greet Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover in Farm Lane still raised and causing flooding, 10th February
item.description:
At the junction of Farm Lane and the Old Bovey, a raised (presumably) storm drain cover is raised and continues to pour water down the road which is now starting to damage the road and causing flooding at the junction of the road with Shurdington Road. At its worst, the water also floods across Shurdington Road and makes entering the lane on foot impossible without wellies. This problem has persisted pretty much for a couple of months now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sequence incorrect., 10th February
item.description:
Currently, the lights on this junction favour traffic from the side roads. Main road traffic, especially the vehicles coming from the main roundabout 200 yds away, is being forced to stop when unnecessary. Surely traffic on the main road in both directions should have priority??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greyhound Gardens, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Light sequence incorrect., 10th February
item.description:
Currently, the lights on this junction favour traffic travelling to Cheltenham AND the airport at the same time and stop all other traffic for far too long. This includes traffic travelling towards Churchdown (Main Road). Surely traffic on the main road in both directions should have priority?? Been like this for at least three weeks if not longer.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working
